alert.note: Alert for Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:49AM EST until January 11 at 7:30AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following county, Waldo. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Standing water from heavy rain and snowmelt is causing flooding issues along area roads. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems and into the area streams. Small stream flooding can be expected to continue through the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 AM EST, Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over primed snowpack. The combined runoff will overwhelm storm drainage systems, particularly around high tide. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Belfast, Camden, Lincolnville, Searsport, Thorndike, Clinton, Prospect, Stockton Springs, Winterport and Islesboro.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
